replies.body:
the thing was that the donor kits weren't even really that op. The normal kits have an even amount of pros and cons, but the donor kits may seem good, but they have quiet a bit of cons that can even the playing field. For example, lets take kit ninja in avicade for red alert, ninja, in a smaller map is really not that great cause you run out of room to run, so the normal kit is much better. These donor kits also have holes in them, and i really haven't heard many people saying that they are. I also have a question, will the exp boost be removed as well? im sorry if i'm bothering someone to answer this question, but i'd like to know.
Thanks for reading :D
replies.body_tagged:

I also have a question, will the exp boost be removed as well? im sorry if i'm bothering someone to answer this question, but i'd like to know.
Thanks for reading :D

replies.body: I support the EULA. It makes a better, and more fair gameplay experience for non donors. Also, you're not donating for the right reasons if you're doing it for perks imo.
replies.body_tagged: I support the EULA. It makes a better, and more fair gameplay experience for non donors. Also, you're not donating for the right reasons if you're doing it for perks imo.

replies.body: Could U keep but hide the xp boost I was gona get emerald for dat o.O
replies.body_tagged: Could U keep but hide the xp boost I was gona get emerald for dat o.O

replies.body: Hmm, I really dont like the EULA system, although it gives a more fair gameplay to regular players. In faction servers you can donate and get a Butt load of tnt, Gapples, God Swords, and more. But for some servers for example MCSG, will probably have a hard time getting through that. Not sure if Hive is going to get affect to much, but it will force them to make a down-graded package. For small servers, I know one thats been shutdown due to nobody donating and the owner ran out of money to pay for it. It really is sad that Mojang is doing this, I don't know why they just wont make a moderating team to "stop" servers from selling over $1,000 USD kits... Why not? I mean its just going to be easier for servers who actually follow the rules to keep going and be successful. I really hope it doesn't screw MCSG, Hive, Avicus, and Overcast. These are the servers I mostly play on and if they get shutdown, I'm just going to quit. Same with youtubers like Yogscast, they've made Minecraft very popular and now they have to deal with this. All I'm saying is that its just sad that they made this, but in some cases its good due to people who aren't able to donate have a fair game to play and such. So that's pretty much all I want to say :).
replies.body_tagged: Hmm, I really dont like the EULA system, although it gives a more fair gameplay to regular players. In faction servers you can donate and get a Butt load of tnt, Gapples, God Swords, and more. But for some servers for example MCSG, will probably have a hard time getting through that. Not sure if Hive is going to get affect to much, but it will force them to make a down-graded package. For small servers, I know one thats been shutdown due to nobody donating and the owner ran out of money to pay for it. It really is sad that Mojang is doing this, I don't know why they just wont make a moderating team to "stop" servers from selling over $1,000 USD kits... Why not? I mean its just going to be easier for servers who actually follow the rules to keep going and be successful. I really hope it doesn't screw MCSG, Hive, Avicus, and Overcast. These are the servers I mostly play on and if they get shutdown, I'm just going to quit. Same with youtubers like Yogscast, they've made Minecraft very popular and now they have to deal with this. All I'm saying is that its just sad that they made this, but in some cases its good due to people who aren't able to donate have a fair game to play and such. So that's pretty much all I want to say :).

replies.body: I have an idea... we keep the donor ranks (and people can pay for the ranks if they would like with hard currency) but you could also unlock the kits from getting an exact amount of soft currency which would be pretty high (since the kits are OP) and you wouldn't be breaking the EULA since it is possible to get the kits in a different way, its not pay to win if you can get the kits to win without paying <3

replies.body:
If you like the EULA, then you obviously don't understand what it will do.
No one will donate if it is just hats and trails. They want a reason. No money means no server.
And there has been a fairly big server that tried to run on donations alone. It flopped.
And there will be that person who truly cares about the server and will donate, but most people want the perks.
TL;DR: The EULA will shut down most servers.
replies.body_tagged:
If you like the EULA, then you obviously don't understand what it will do.

And there has been a fairly big server that tried to run on donations alone. It flopped.
And there will be that person who truly cares about the server and will donate, but most people want the perks.
TL;DR: The EULA will shut down most servers.

reply_to.body: Hmm, I really dont like the EULA system, although it gives a more fair gameplay to regular players. In faction servers you can donate and get a Butt load of tnt, Gapples, God Swords, and more. But for some servers for example MCSG, will probably have a hard time getting through that. Not sure if Hive is going to get affect to much, but it will force them to make a down-graded package. For small servers, I know one thats been shutdown due to nobody donating and the owner ran out of money to pay for it. It really is sad that Mojang is doing this, I don't know why they just wont make a moderating team to "stop" servers from selling over $1,000 USD kits... Why not? I mean its just going to be easier for servers who actually follow the rules to keep going and be successful. I really hope it doesn't screw MCSG, Hive, Avicus, and Overcast. These are the servers I mostly play on and if they get shutdown, I'm just going to quit. Same with youtubers like Yogscast, they've made Minecraft very popular and now they have to deal with this. All I'm saying is that its just sad that they made this, but in some cases its good due to people who aren't able to donate have a fair game to play and such. So that's pretty much all I want to say :).

Not sure if Hive is going to get affect to much, but it will force them to make a down-graded package. For small servers, I know one thats been shutdown due to nobody donating and the owner ran out of money to pay for it. It really is sad that Mojang is doing this, I don't know why they just wont make a moderating team to "stop" servers from selling over $1,000 USD kits... Why not? I mean its just going to be easier for servers who actually follow the rules to keep going and be successful. I really hope it doesn't screw MCSG, Hive, Avicus, and Overcast. These are the servers I mostly play on and if they get shutdown, I'm just going to quit. Same with youtubers like Yogscast, they've made Minecraft very popular and now they have to deal with this. All I'm saying is that its just sad that they made this, but in some cases its good due to people who aren't able to donate have a fair game to play and such. So that's pretty much all I want to say :).

This server has the most balanced donor/non-donor system I have come across. I find it unfair at people moaning about the kits like pyro being "op". It really is really balanced. 

A kit is only as good as the person who uses it.
